dreisoft.tresos.launcher2.api.module.transform

Class AbstractModuleTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.lib2.platform.AbstractExecutableExtension
      • dreisoft.tresos.launcher2.api.module.transform.AbstractModuleTransformer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension

    public abstract class AbstractModuleTransformer
extends dreisoft.tresos.lib2.platform.AbstractExecutableExtension
    This class must be implemented to provide a ModuleTransformer which can be registered via the Eclipse extension-point dreisoft.tresos.launcher2.plugin.moduleTransformer. The transformation is provided by implementing doTransform(dreisoft.tresos.launcher2.api.module.ModuleDescription, dreisoft.tresos.launcher2.api.module.ModuleDescription, dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.DCtxt). The doTransform method gets a description of the loaded module (the untransformed one) and the target module (to which the transformation should be done in form of ModuleDescriptions.

    The actual configuration that should be transformed is handed in in the form of a DCtxt that points to the MODULE-CONFIGURATION container node.

    The DCtxt is configured in the following way:

    • Opt.setNoSchema( true ): The configuration is not bound to a schema (and therefore no schema information is available
    • Opt.setUseNodeOperations( false ): Changes go directly to the configuration as no UI elements are involved
    • Opt.setExistingNodesOnly( false ): Also non existing nodes can be modified
    • Opt.setAddMissingChilds( false ): No nodes are added automatically

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    2008.a

      • doTransform

        public abstract boolean doTransform(ModuleDescription sourceModule,
                                    ModuleDescription targetModule,
                                    DCtxt moduleConfiguration)
        This method is called to transform a model during import. The model handed in is already fixed against the schema (but not bound as all nodes reside in a resource).
        Parameters:
        sourceModule - The information of the original module for which the configuration was made
        targetModule - The information of the module to which the configuration must be converted to
        moduleConfiguration - The toplevel node of the configuration (this is the <d:ctr type="MODULE-CONFIGURATION">)
        Returns:
        false if the transformation did not succeed (transformation also fails if errors were added with addStatus(dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.log.APIOperationStatus).
        Since:
        2008.a

      • addStatus

        public void addStatus(APIOperationStatus status)
        Add an error, warning or info message. Errors, Warnings and Infos are handed in as APIOperation status. See the dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api plug-in for more information. If at least on error was added the transformation is considered as having failed.
        Parameters:
        status - The message to add
        Since:
        2008.a
